body: There is a framework for dealing with this now and it should be easy enough to do.

@Technifocal 
Is this still an issue with rclone 1.54 ??

@ncw 
Can we confirm this bug without submitter?
yes -> relabel as bug
no -> close it

Yes it is still valid.

To fix it needs the `quotaExceeded` error detecting about here

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/7dc7c021dbacfd5be2390ce12625b6449413cc0e/backend/drive/drive.go#L660-L663

And a fatal error returned which will stop the sync.

issue.title: drive: Raise fatal error when quota exceeded

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Extend the shouldRetry function by also checking for the quotaExceeded
reason, and since this function appeared to be untested, add a test case
for the existing errors and this new one.

I am very much a Go novice, and the tests don't quite pass, so I'd welcome
feedback on how to best improve it.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Discussed in #615 , as was the solution I implemented

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
